body.name: All-New 2023 WiFi Extender 1.2Gb/s Signal Booster – Dual Band 5GHz & 2.4GHz, New Generation up to 4X Faster, Longest Range Than Ever Super Antennas, Signal Amplifier w/Ethernet Port, Alexa Compatible
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 14 hrs 29 mins
features: Introducing The Newest Dual Band WiFi Range Extender Signal Booster with Ethernet Port by MACARD. WiFi booster and signal amplifier penetrates walls and floors, extends your internet wireless network to every corner of your house, and beyond.

Incredible Performance & Ultra High Internet Speed: Dual Band technology with 5G and 2.4 GHz driven by Advanced Macard 2-Core Central Processor boost your internet at long range and ultra-speeds up to 1200 Mbps.

Made for humans. Set up as 123. You must not be Tech-savvy. Can you press a button? You’re set! Just tap the WPS button to pair wifi repeater with your wifi router or modem. Unbox. Plug in. Hold by the router. Tap. Enjoy!

The USA Engineered - While most WiFi extenders signal booster for home get stuck behind thick walls, appliances, and cement floors, MACARD delivers ultra-stable bandwidth for online gaming, video conferences, and even laggy free streaming even 4K video.

INDUSTRY-LEADING SECURITY: The Bionic Encryption Chip facilitates the latest advanced WEP/WPA/WPA2 security protocols and keeps your personal data protected. It creates an ultimate formidable wall of safety and defense for business and privacy protection.

Macard WiFi Extender signal range booster eliminate Wi-Fi dead spots, pumping out interference-free, lightning-fast data capabilities to all smartphones, smart speakers, IoT and Alexa devices, Blink, Ring, IP cameras, ROKU, FIRE TV Stick, PS5, and whatever WIFI supporting device the interwebs invents next.
Supports up to 47 devices, 5 Ghz and 2.4 Ghz - Dual Band.
The ethernet port allow to deploy an access point. JWMLVIRNG compatible

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars really boosts the wifi signal
reviews.reviewText: simple to setup. nice feature is when you log into the extender it guides you through the process, very handy. and if you for some reason have problems they have live tech support one button away. before i bought this, my wifi couldnt reach the other side of the house without dropouts. i would get maybe one bar. installed this (took 3 minutes) and full bars everywhere. i can even now go clear down to a big metal shop 200 feet away and still get 3 bars inside( metal buildings are a wifi killer). neat function is you can move it around after initial setup to anyplace that has a power outlet. also has a lan port built in if you have something that needs it instead of wifi. well worth the money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy Setup Strong Signal
reviews.reviewText: My WiFi connection on the second story of our house was weak or wouldn’t work at all. I purchased this item because I found it fairly inexpensive and figured that I’d give it a try. I’m very happy with my choice. Easy setup and now we have a strong signal. No more issues!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really Nice extender
reviews.reviewText: Bought this extender to try to help the wifi in our basement and it has worked really well. It seems to even connect the internet better all over our house. Setup was easy and and it has worked well!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect Solution for Basement
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for a low cost option to improve the WIFI signal in my basement without investing in a mesh system. I already had an ethernet cable in the basement connected to my router on the first floor. Set-up was fairly easy. I've been using it for about 2 months and it's worked perfectly. The signal is strong. I use it primarily for my 65" HDTV.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Easy install great customer service
reviews.reviewText: It sets up nice and easy over wifi from phone. Customer service seems great. I bought to increase my wifi to the back yard. It's winter here so haven't used back yard much. It has both 2g and 5g and option to use Lan cable to give stonger range I believe. The speed my regular wifi currently 64 mbps and extender 13.1 mbps. So there is a drop. It says it's fast on speed test and can run multiple devices. Hope so as I have wifi compatible devices I use in back yard in Summer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It works very well.
reviews.reviewText: It was quick and very easy to set up by following the instructions. I used it to get a stronger wi -to signal in the other end of my residence. It boosted a weak signal to a strong signal. It serves my purpose and I am very happy with it. I Would recommend this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very Good WiFi Extender
reviews.reviewText: Very Good WiFi Extender to help reach the far corners of our home on the opposite end of the house from the modem. No trouble setting it up at all. Have only had it for 3 weeks, but it seems to function very well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: So far so good ..... Product was fairly easy to setup and the extended Wi-Fi signal appears to be strong although I haven't checked the farthest reaches outside in my yard due to weather conditions (rain). I live in a typical subdivision with a typical size yard.I had initial trouble with the QR code as the internet reference page locked, but I opened another window and typed in the numerical sequence in the information packet and followed the instructions and everything is good. I would advise to plug the unit into an outlet where your Wi-Fi box is located so you get maximum interface with the extender when setting the unit up. You can then move the Wi-Fi extender to whatever area you want, and it will reconnect. I would have given it another half star or more, but I haven't been able to experience how the unit holds up and the extent of its range. Overall, I am fairly happy with the unit at this time.
